Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Prescribing Taxable Goods Imported by Mail or Courier

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to subsection 277(1)* of the Excise Tax Act, is pleased hereby to make the annexed Regulations prescribing taxable goods imported by mail or courier.

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Mail and Courier Imports (GST/HST) Regulations.
In these Regulations, Act means the Excise Tax Act. (Loi)
For the purposes of section 7 of Schedule VII to the Act, the following imported goods are prescribed goods:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: goods that are prescribed property for the purposes of section 143.1 of the Act, if the supplier of the goods is required to register under Subdivision d of Division V of Part IX of the Act and is not so registered;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: goods for which the value for duty is reduced by the application of section 85 of the Customs Tariff;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: goods that are purchased from a retailer in Canada and mailed or transported from outside Canada directly to the purchaser; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: goods that are purchased or ordered through or from a person in Canada acting for or on behalf of a person outside Canada who is selling the goods.

Subsection.Text: Subsection 2(1) applies to goods imported after November 26, 1997.
